data.title: Information Builders presentation at the Chief Analytics Officer Forum East Coast USA (#CAOForum)
data.meta_description: Information Builders presentation at the Chief Analytics Officer Forum East Coast USA (#CAOForum) - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
1. Self-Service Analytics is the New Competitive Advantage Michael Corcoran Sr. Vice President Information Builders 1

3. Do Users Spend More Time Gathering Data Than Analyzing It?

4. Does “BI” mean “Bottlenecked Intelligence”? Finance Supply Chain Partners Operations Customers Information Technology

5. Do Your Analytic Tools Find Discrepancies or Create Them?

6. Has “Justifying Information” Become Routine?

7. Copyright 2007, Information Builders. Slide 7 Self-Service Business Intelligence and Analytics IT Business The Business Takes Ownership Of Process And Intelligence Forrester highlights that IT is losing its control over business intelligence platforms, tools and applications often due to IT’s inability to operate at the increased pace of the business. The report also notes that business process management, again a traditional domain of IT by-and-large, is increasingly becoming the domain of other functions as “a new class of users demands more user-friendly, self-service features to automate ad hoc processes without expensive and scarce IT resources.” - Forrester Research

8. Who Needs It? Business Intelligence & Analytics Business Analyst Operational Worker Data Scientist Partners Customers Data Mining Statistics Predictive Spreadsheets Data Discovery Query & Analysis Managers Mobile Apps Portal e-Statements In-store Kiosk Supplier, Distributor, Retailer Portals Decision Support Apps Reports Performance Metrics Event-driven Alerts Dashboards Scorecards Powerpoint Production Reports Back Office Operations, Partners, Customers22% 78%

9. Self-Service BI & Analytics for Everyone Information Builders’ Strategy for Customers Pervasive (Operational) BI and Analytics Employees Operational Reporting & Alerts, Decision Support, Performance Benchmarks Operationalize Insights, Change Culture, Optimize Processes Performance Benchmarks, Information Exchange Partners, Suppliers & Distributors Operational Optimize Supply Chain, Meet SLA’s Eliminate Waste Customers, Citizens, Patients & Students Vital Self-service Experience, e-Statements New Revenue, Loyalty/Retention, Public Awareness Data Monetization Back-Office BI and Analytics Executive Management Strategic Metrics Dashboards Scorecards High-level Decision-making Analysts Analytical Analytics Advanced Analytics Generate Insight, Identify Problems & Trends Organizational Role Analytical Requirements Analytical Users Results

10. The Power of Broad Analytic Adoption 10 1. Generates insights to fuel new ideas 2. Leads to monetization strategy and growth

11. Data Monetization Information as a revenue generating product  New opportunities from the data you have  Adding value by adding data  Big data drives new opportunities The New Customer Online Experience  Self-service insight  Consumer loyalty  Competitive differentiation  Educating your customer through insight Driving Profit Through Behavior  Comparative benchmarking  Employee performance  Partner performance  Eliminating Fraud, Waste and Abuse 11 Driving Revenue and Profitability From Your Data

12. InformationWeek 2015 CIO Survey Top Barriers to Analytics and BI Success

13. Information Builders’ 3i Platform Transforming Data Into Business Value 13

14. Broadest Self-Service BI & Analytics Offering WebFOCUS InfoAssist+ Visual Data Discovery Reporting Interactive Publishing Mobile Content Rapid Dashboards MS-Office Documents InfoAssist+

15. Self-Service Business Intelligence and Analytics 15 Tools vs Apps

16. IT Developers Management Operational Employees Business Partners Customers Tools for IT and Analysts; InfoAppsTM for the Masses Self-Service BI and Analytics for Everyone 16 App Studio InfoAssist+ Data Discovery Predictive Analytics Social Intelligence Search Location Intelligence Reporting Query and Analysis Dashboards Generate & Deploy Insights InfoAppsTM Dashboards & Scorecards Governed Self-service Reporting Mobile InfoApps E-Statements Data Discovery InfoApps Predictive InfoApps Search & Social Analytic InfoApps Portal Create your own App Store experience Operationalize Insights & Monetize Data Business Analysts

17.  Total view of the business  Proactive vs Reactive management Management Operational Workers Business Partners Customers Roles and Responsibilities 17 Self-Service for Everyone Business Analysts Information Technology  Publish Visualizations, Reports and Dashboards  Create highly Interactive analytic Apps for the masses.  Leverage Analyst content  Manage and govern data.  Operationalize insights  Real-time decision-making  Optimized business processes  Drive performance/accountability  Align partner performance  Ensures SLA’s are met  Improved customer experience  Improved experience/loyalty  New revenue
